intro: Rehmannia chingii f. purpureopunctata, commonly known as the purple-spotted rehmannia, is a rare and ornamental plant native to China. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple-pink flowers with dark purple spots. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soil. It is typically grown in shaded or semi-shaded environments, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued in horticultural collections.
